page.title: 04Winter in New Deer
page.content: There was a terrific snowstorm at the end of January 1984 and a large area in central Buchan around New Deer was severely affected by the damage done to electricity and water supplies and the disruption of transport. Many thousands of wooden electricity poles were snapped or brought down by the weight of ice on the cables. In many cases the replacement poles had to be ferried in by helicopter. The lack of electricity meant that numerous farms had no water because they relied on electrical pumps. Some households were without electricity for 14 days despite the fact that engineers had been draughted in from all over Scotland and even from the North of England.
